meta.title: Digg - What the Internet is talking about right now

div.div: GUESS WHICH IS THE MOST IMPORTANT

div.a: The 20 Most Significant Inventions In The History Of Food And Drink

div.div: The Royal Society, the UK's national academy of science, had a question: What are the most meaningful innovations in humanity's culinary history?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RQneq6&via=Digg&text=The 20 Most Significant Inventions In The History Of Food And Drink

div.div: SELL-OUTS

div.a: How Apple Broke Up With Indie Pop

div.div: Apple used to like cool music. What happened, man?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/ONgPHA&via=Digg&text=How Apple Broke Up With Indie Pop

div.div: NOT SAFE FOR WORK... OR LIFE

div.a: No One Murdered Because Of This Image

div.div: Following the publication of the image above, in which the most cherished figures from multiple religious faiths were depicted engaging in a lascivious sex act of considerable depravity, no one was murdered, beaten, or had their lives threatened, sources reported Thursday.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/QTyK45&via=Digg&text=No One Murdered Because Of This Image

div.div: PLEASE TAKE MY MONEY

div.a: Valve Has A Sweet New Portal Turret That Actually (Sort Of) Works

div.div: "Oh my GOD look at this just LOOK AT THIS" is all I'd be able to manage, before ducking behind a couch for cover. Just in case.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/O2UUk7&via=Digg&text=Valve Has A Sweet New Portal Turret That Actually (Sort Of) Works

div.div: Without fanfare, astronomers have redefined one of the most important distances in the Solar System.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/R3tN3i&via=Digg&text=The Astronomical Unit Gets Fixed

div.div: FREE SPEECH

div.a: Twitter Hands Over Occupy Wall Street Tweets To Judge

div.div: Twitter handed over tweets from an Occupy Wall Street protester to a New York criminal judge on Friday after months of fighting a subpoena from prosecutors in a closely watched case pitting privacy and free speech advocates against law enforcement.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/OuTgaH&via=Digg&text=Twitter Hands Over Occupy Wall Street Tweets To Judge

div.div: BOOB TAPE

div.a: The Physics Of The Strapless Evening Gown

div.div: Once over the lingering pleasure of the many ways in which women dress, the author gets down to the question at hand, namely: How DOES this type of dress stay up?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/QKiQa7&via=Digg&text=The Physics Of The Strapless Evening Gown

div.div: MORE THAN JUST NUMBERS

div.a: The Human Cost Of Syria's Uprising Explained In One Chart

div.div: Syria's 18-month revolution-turned-war is taking an increasing toll on the population.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/QenltP&via=Digg&text=The Human Cost Of Syria's Uprising Explained In One Chart

div.div: LOOK AWAY, CHILDREN
European street art collective “The Wierd” joined together with various other artists to coat a wall in Differdange, Luxembourg with a Disney-inspired seemingly never-ending freak-show nightmare.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Ubdljg&via=Digg&text=Disturbing Disney Street Art

div.div: THE BOSS

div.a: The Anatomy Of A Bruce Springsteen Setlist

div.div: One reason fans keep flocking to Bruce Springsteen shows — including Friday’s sold-out show at Nationals Park — is that an element of surprise exists from night to night, a rarity when it comes to arena-size concerts, where what people pay for is less a music event than a carefully choreographed production.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/OkwtZt&via=Digg&text=The Anatomy Of A Bruce Springsteen Setlist

div.div: IN CASE YOU'VE BEEN WONDERING
It sounds a bit like a commercial, because it is a commercial.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SKIq2b&via=Digg&text=How Bitcoin Works

div.div: FUNDAMENTALIST AUTUMN?

div.a: A Map Of Muslim Protests Around The World

div.div: If you can't keep track of all the Muslim protests erupting across the globe, you're not alone.

li.div: RT @gabrielsnyder: The number of protests today is staggering. @John_Hudson has a Google Map to keep track: theatlanticwire.com/global...

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RPloWs&via=Digg&text=A Map Of Muslim Protests Around The World

div.div: GOOD NEWS? IMPOSSIBLE

div.a: Wait, We're Winning The War On Poverty?

div.div: "We may not have won the war on poverty, but we are certainly winning."

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RPakbQ&via=Digg&text=Wait, We're Winning The War On Poverty?

div.div: LIFE ON MARS

div.a: Are These Iron 'Blueberries' Sign Of Microbial Life On Mars?

div.div: It’s unlikely anything lives on Mars today, but it may well have done so millions or billions of years past. And it may have left traces of its existence in the geology of the red planet.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/QV9gxM&via=Digg&text=Are These Iron 'Blueberries' Sign Of Microbial Life On Mars?

div.div: DON'T TRY THIS AT HOME

div.a: How Often Do Plane Stowaways Fall From The Sky?

div.div: With a nearly a 75% fatality rate, hitching a ride in a plane's wheel-well is not advised.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/OubbhQ&via=Digg&text=How Often Do Plane Stowaways Fall From The Sky?

div.div: ONE-STOP SHOP FOR PROCRASTINATION

div.a: This Site Will Suck Up What Few Hours Of Productivity You Have Left

div.div: Chrome Experiments is a showcase for creative web experiments, the vast majority of which are built with the latest open technologies, including HTML5, Canvas, SVG, and WebGL. All of them were made and submitted by talented artists and programmers from around the world.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Q8YEw5&via=Digg&text=This Site Will Suck Up What Few Hours Of Productivity You Have Left

div.div: WHITE HAT

div.a: Twitter Hires Elite Apple Hacker To Beef Up Its Security Team

div.div: In Twitter’s early days, hackers enjoyed breaking into the company’s accounts to embarrass news anchors or make obscene jokes about Britney Spears’ nether regions. Lately, it seems like world-class hackers are less interested in attacking Twitter, and more interested in working there.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RWCDE3&via=Digg&text=Twitter Hires Elite Apple Hacker To Beef Up Its Security Team

div.div: JUST F*CKIN' MAKE IT SO!

div.a: Even Patrick Stewart Has Problems With Time Warner Cable

div.div: Patrick Stewart remains the best, but if Captain Picard can't even get Time Warner Cable to make it so, what hope is there for the rest of us?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UT8Z2u&via=Digg&text=Even Patrick Stewart Has Problems With Time Warner Cable

div.div: SKULL AND CROSSBONES NEXT

div.a: Chris Brown Albums Slapped With 'Do Not Buy' Stickers

div.div: Copies of Chris Brown's current album Fortune have been marked by stickers warning against purchasing the album as he 'beats women'.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/PzVHYb&via=Digg&text=Chris Brown Albums Slapped With 'Do Not Buy' Stickers

div.div: DANGEROUS SCIENCE

div.a: The Scientist Who Almost Died While Debunking 'The Hottest Day On Earth'

div.div: The world record for the hottest recorded temperature of 58°C (136.4°F) was set at Al Azizia, Libya, in 1922. This year, a team of researchers — including one who was almost killed in Libya's 2011 revolution — invalidated that record. Here's the harrowing story of how they did it.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/PiZuY3&via=Digg&text=The Scientist Who Almost Died While Debunking 'The Hottest Day On Earth'

div.div: MUSIC HISTORY

div.a: Was This Peruvian Group The First Punk Band?

div.div: Almost a decade before the Ramones or the Sex Pistols struck a chord in anger, los Saicos were screaming their way to notoriety

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/OnNrq2&via=Digg&text=Was This Peruvian Group The First Punk Band?
